subject: Re: [junit] How can I test async callbacks?
msgSnippet: Here s what my first try at a callback test would look like. I ve never written one before, and I have nothing here to try this on. public class CallbackTest
messageBody:
Here's what my first try at a callback test would look like. I've
never written one before, and I have nothing here to try this on.

public class CallbackTest extends Test {

public void testIt() {
m_model.getData(this);
}

public void ok(Object result) {
Data data = (Data) result;
// If this fails I'd like TestResult to record it.
assertNotNull(data);
}

public void error(Throwable t) {
// I'd like to report t back to TestResult
fail(t.toString());
}
}
--
Joi Ellis Software Engineer
Aravox Technologies joi@..., gyles19@...

that kicks a monopoly in the pants has got to be good for something.
